Public Security Records

Last updated: March 2017

Why we have to record

Computer Information International Network Security Protection Management Measures (Ministry of Public Security Decree 33) approved and issued by the State Council stipulates that:

Article 11 A Users shall fill in the user record form when going through the formalities of accessing the network at the receiving institution. The user record form shall be prepared under the supervision of the Ministry of Public Security.

Article 12 Internetworking institutions, receiving institutions, legal persons and other organizations that use the international network of computer information networks (including cross-province, cross-autonomous region and cross-municipality directly under Central Government internetworking units and their branches) should go through the formalities to record at the processing agencies designated by the public security organs of the governments of the provinces, autonomous regions and municipalities directly under the Central Government wherein the units are located within 30 days starting from the date of formal connection of the network.

The institutions listed in the preceding article shall be responsible for reporting the information on the receiving institutions and users connecting to the network to local public security organizations and report changes in the receiving institutions and users connecting to this network in a timely manner.
